meanings.definition: The act of running into a place or area.
meanings.sent1: The inruns of the children into the playground filled the air with laughter.
meanings.sent2: The deer made quick inruns into the forest to escape the approaching storm.
meanings.sent3: The inruns of the puppy into the mud puddle left a messy trail behind.
meanings.sent4: The inruns of the waves onto the shore created a soothing sound.
meanings.sent5: The inruns of the students into the classroom signaled the start of the school day.

meanings.definition: A series of runs made within a specific area or boundary.
meanings.sent1: The inruns of the marathon runners around the track were impressive.
meanings.sent2: The soccer team practiced their inruns within the marked field.
meanings.sent3: The inruns of the ants along the sidewalk were like a tiny parade.
meanings.sent4: The inruns of the cars in the race track were a blur of colors.
meanings.sent5: The inruns of the skier down the slope were graceful and precise.
